Detailed Description

Functions for ILK initialization, configuration, and monitoring.

Revision
41586

Function Documentation

int __cvmx_helper_ilk_enable ( int  xiface  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Bringup and enable ILK interface. After this call packet I/O should be fully functional. This is called with IPD enabled but PKO disabled.

Parameters:
xiface Interface to bring up
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

int __cvmx_helper_ilk_probe ( int  xiface  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Probe a ILK interface and determine the number of ports connected to it. The ILK interface should still be down after this call.

Parameters:
xiface Interface to probe
Returns:
Number of ports on the interface. Zero to disable.

void __cvmx_ilk_clear_cal ( int  interface  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Initialize all calendar entries.

Parameters:
interface Interface whose calendar is to be initialized.
static void __cvmx_ilk_clear_cal_cn68xx ( int  interface  )  [static]

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Initialize all tx calendar entries to the xoff state. Initialize all rx calendar entries to the xon state. The rx calendar entries must be in the xon state to allow new pko pipe assignments. If a calendar entry is assigned a different pko pipe while in the xoff state, the old pko pipe will stay in the xoff state even when no longer used by ilk.

Parameters:
interface Interface whose calendar are to be initialized.
static void __cvmx_ilk_clear_cal_cn78xx ( int  intf  )  [static]

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Initialize all tx calendar entries to the xoff state. Initialize all rx calendar entries to the xon state. The rx calendar entries must be in the xon state to allow new pko pipe assignments. If a calendar entry is assigned a different pko pipe while in the xoff state, the old pko pipe will stay in the xoff state even when no longer used by ilk.

Parameters:
intf Interface whose calendar are to be initialized.
